messages.subject: Re: Digest #
messages.msgSnippet: ... Nicki, I apologize if I ve seemed to be targeting you in any way -- I frequently lose track of who I m talking to  in these discussions and tend to just
messages.messageBody:
----------
>From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1414
>Date: Thu, Sep 6, 2001, 3:18 PM
>

> I am trying my hardest to be a Zen mommy but I do at times lose it and yell.
> Zoe also yells. I believe it is in us but we can change and want to.I am not
> condoning yelling at my child in anger,I hate when I do it but I admit to
> doing it. I do however feel it is better than what I grew up w/ which was
> shaming and blaming and name calling. So I am at least doing better than the
> generation before me.
>
> Am I understood yet? Or do you still think I am a person to steer clear of?


Nicki, I apologize if I've seemed to be targeting you in any way -- I
frequently lose track of who I'm talking to <g> in these discussions and
tend to just clip what seems relevant to me at the time, regardless of
poster.

I have no reason to believe I'd be steering clear of you.

Pam
